channel.title: Audio player code
channel.description: [code] InputStream in = new FileInputStream("/Music/song.mid"); AudioStream as = new AudioStream(in); AudioPlayer.player.start(as); [/code] According to my compiler [quote] Jframe.java:33: warning: AudioStream is internal proprietary API and may be remo ved in a future release AudioStream as = new AudioStream(in); ^ Jframe.java:33: warning: AudioStream is internal proprietary API and may be remo ved in a future release AudioStream as = new AudioStream(in); ^ Jframe.java:34: warning: AudioPlayer is internal proprietary API and may be remo ved in a future release AudioPlayer.player.start(as); ^ Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 warnings Press any key to continue . . . [/code] Any idea what the "newer" code would be to do this? Or am I taking this the wrong way... (just woke up)

item.title: Audio player code
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

			  InputStream in = new FileInputStream("/Music/song.mid");
			  AudioStream as = new AudioStream(in);
			  AudioPlayer.player.start(as);

According to my compiler

[quote]
Jframe.java:33: warning: AudioStream is internal proprietary API and may be remo
ved in a future release
AudioStream as = new AudioStream(in);
^
Jframe.java:33: warning: AudioStream is internal proprietary API and may be remo
ved in a future release
AudioStream as = new AudioStream(in);
^
Jframe.java:34: warning: AudioPlayer is internal proprietary API and may be remo
ved in a future release
AudioPlayer.player.start(as);
^
Note: client.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
3 warnings
Press any key to continue . . .
[/code]
Any idea what the “newer” code would be to do this? Or am I taking this the wrong way…
(just woke up)
